metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6941 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
win_useradd, salt-cloud and the Linode driver in salt 2015.5.x before 2015.5.6, and 2015.8.x before 2015.8.1 leak password information in debug logs. It was discovered that the salt has a vulnerability where it exposes sensitive informations in the log files. An attacker could use this retrieve it.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6941` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-common - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-master - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-minion - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-ssh - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-syndic - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
